sentences.english: He is just a dishonest trickster.
sentences.chinese: 牀破只是一個不誠實的騙子。

sentences.english: They were the dupes of a clever but dishonest salesman.
sentences.chinese: 他們被一個聰明但不誠實的推銷員騙了。

sentences.english: The dishonest manager defrauded the company of millions of pounds.
sentences.chinese: 這個不誠實的經理詐取了公司幾百萬英鎊。

sentences.english: She never tells the truth. I think she's quite dishonest .
sentences.chinese: 她從來不說真話，我認爲她非常不誠實。

sentences.english: As I've written earlier, human beings have an innate skill at dishonesty.
sentences.chinese: 如我以前所寫，人類在不誠實上有一種天生的才能。

sentences.english: But it's counterpart, dishonesty, is one of the five most destructive Love Busters.
sentences.chinese: 但是相應的，不誠實，是五個最能摧毀愛的因素之一。

sentences.english: There is reason to believe that he is dishonest .
sentences.chinese: 有理由相信他是不誠實的。

sentences.english: She taxed her friend with dishonesty.
The witness asserted that the salesman was dishonest.
sentences.chinese: 目擊者斷言那售貨員是不誠實的。

sentences.english: He will never be dishonest even though hebe reduced to poverty.
sentences.chinese: 他決不會不誠實，縱然淪落到貧困境地。

sentences.english: If you plant selfishness, you will reap loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 如果你種植不誠實，你將收穫不城信。

sentences.english: He acted dishonestly when he gave the contract to his best friend.
sentences.chinese: 他不誠實地把那份合同交給了自己最好的朋友。

sentences.english: He bridled at the suggestion that he had been dishonest.
sentences.chinese: 他對說他不誠實的意見很生氣。

sentences.english: Profit made dishonestly always brings trouble.
sentences.chinese: 由不誠實的手段帶來的利益最後都會引來麻煩事。

sentences.english: If you plant dishonesty, you will reap distrust.
sentences.chinese: 如果你種植不誠實，你將收穫不城信。

definition: to speak for sb/to intercede for sb/to lobby illegally
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to be greedy in getting money
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to accuse/to denounce/to make a complaint against/denunciation
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
